page.title: 06FARMING IN WINTERINGHAM
page.content: The two distinct types of soil,shallow and light over the limestone, deep and heavy in the reclained marshland, are the reason for the two main types of agricultural usage. Large areas of grain almost devoid of hedges and trees are found on the limestone hills, root crops and grassland on the low lying riverside. Several large farms are equipped with the most modern sophisticated machinery, though some medium and small farms are not so favoured. There are many old field names still in use.Rotten Sykes, an ancient flax preparation area, Pong Shop, an area once used as a knackers yard, Lock Nine,Wrigglesworth, Pudding Poke, Thrush Church, Benefield, The Groves, Seeds field, Agnestone, The Croft, Rouths Ochard, Ottersfield, Hall Close, Cliff One, Two and Three, Auden Flatts and Long Marsh.
